text: I didn’t find a way to fetch user email address with any endpoint of HubSpot API. :disappointed:

Hi guys,
I have this problem, how can i fix it?

Hello devs
What does  error message "Invalid contactId returned by HubSpot" means ?

I was actually referring to street address, city and country. In account settings, there is a place to add location information. However, I have been unable to retrieve this information through the GET /account-info/v3/details? endpoint.
Thank you for your help, <@U03QW1MF3S6>!
can you give more context to this error? What are you doing, what are you expecting while doing it

that means the contact id you are sending is not valid…

so you are either sending an email address or some invalid property, or you are sending an ID that is deleted, or not id at all
I'm trying: <https://api.hubapi.com/extensions/ecomm/v2/stores/magento-501>
with oauth token
what url are you sending to that?
It looks like this is a specific api and not a HubSpot api
URL: <https://api.hubapi.com/extensions/ecomm/v2/stores/magento-501>
yeah, I have no clue what url you are sending to
I’m not sure how that api is setup and what you would need, sorry
i need to get detail of a store
<@U25PYL3Q8> Do you know how to resolve that issue?
no, i’m thinking you have some sort of HubSpot plugin or somethign that is running — I don’t know anything about that api

Hello, I am using Hevo to connect our dw to HubSpot and I keep getting an error. Has anyone used Hevo to drive data into HS?

I continue getting an error of null values on the Hbuspot side, but I've found several examples where email address values exist both on the Hevo side and the HubSpot side, so I'm not sure why there is suddenly a disconnect and their support has not been helpful.

hi folks, I was wondering if it’s possible to trigger notifications on the HubSpot CRM side through the API? Just like the “send notification action” through Workflow

our use case is that we listen for changes in the CRM via the webhook, then do some complex validations and calculations on our side, and in case of errors mark the record as “dirty” - we would like our users to get notified while in the CRM to go and fix the error in the record

alternative would be to set this up in Workflow, if the record is marked as dirty, but was wondering if this can be done directly
<@U03R9GYJV28> I've built out a custom Notifications API to solve this exact problem. Here's a demo of it: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C0121KGC6RM/p1646839716637449>
Let me know if you have any questions

Hi there!
We have created an App in a dev account. Is there a way to install this App on *multiple independant portals* without pushing it into the market place? We don’t want to make our App Public for security reasons. Thank you in advance to anyone who can help me!
Yes, just use redirect url that you would use in the marketplace
Hi Carter, thanks for replying. What do you mean exactly?
This is on the app settings page, you would need these urls to put your app on the marketplace anyway.
ok thanks. I’m looking for a way to not put the App public on the Market place
I understand that. just by using that install url anyone can install your app
I’m curious what the process is for this — how does one build a private app and have others install it? What is the process of this?

Hello everyone! I'm trying to use the Custom Property API for contacts. 
Is there a way to Update a contact Custom property Value via API? Just the value. I have done the research but still don't know how to achieved it :expressionless:
You would patch the contacts object record. The properties API is not for individual records. Rather it is to change the property for an overall object
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts>

<@U25PYL3Q8> just want to make sure terminology is correct, private apps are apps that operate per hub and you have to setup manually. "Private Apps" (Unlisted HubSpot Apps) are apps that aren't shown in the marketplace. To build a HubSpot app you have to have a install server setup (nodejs) which installs something on the users HubSpot after authentication. Below is the example source for setting up a simple OAuth 2.0 app: <https://github.com/HubSpot/oauth-quickstart-nodejs>
<@U030VV2NKST>, Carter is spot on. To be in the marketplace, you have to submit the app.
AHH okay, I understand this <@U01QVR44MEY> — I was a bit confused when you said private apps but I understand what you mean by private apps now. thanks!
Thanks!!!

Hello!

Does renaming a Private App have any operational impact?

Details:

I'd like to rename a Private App, to reduce the chances of confusion in new staff onboarding and during incident response scenarios. (The current name is randomly-generated, and I'd like to use one that is a bit more descriptive for our context.)

Since we use this particular Private App in production, I want to make absolutely sure that renaming it will have no other impact. No changes to the access token, no permission scope changes, etc.

Based on my testing, I believe the name change only changes the name. But I thought I'd ask here since this isn't addressed in the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/private-apps|help docs> or in the descriptive text above the name change field ("This name will appear in your private apps page, some HubSpot tools, and other material. It must be unique for this account.")

Thanks!
